verses.text: He, that being often reproved hardeneth \add his\add* neck, Shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: But when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.
Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: But he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth \add his\add* substance.
The king by judgment stablisheth the land: But he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.
A man that flattereth his neighbour Spreadeth a net for his feet.
In the transgression of an evil man \add there is\add* a snare: But the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: \add But\add* the wicked regardeth not to know \add it\add*.
Scornful men bring a city into a snare: But wise \add men\add* turn away wrath.
If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, Whether he rage or laugh, \add there is\add* no rest.
The bloodthirsty hate the upright: But the just seek his soul.
A fool uttereth all his mind: But a wise \add man\add* keepeth it in \add till\add* afterwards.
If a ruler hearken to lies, All his servants \add are\add* wicked.
The poor and the deceitful man meet together: The \sc Lord\sc* lighteneth both their eyes.
The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, His throne shall be established for ever.
The rod and reproof give wisdom: But a child left \add to himself\add* bringeth his mother to shame.
When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: But the righteous shall see their fall.
Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; Yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
Where \add there is\add* no vision, the people perish: But he that keepeth the law, happy \add is\add* he.
A servant will not be corrected by words: For though he understand he will not answer.
Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? \add There is\add* more hope of a fool than of him.
He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child Shall have him become \add his\add* son at the length.
An angry man stirreth up strife, And a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
A man’s pride shall bring him low: But honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: He heareth cursing, and bewrayeth \add it\add* not.
The fear of man bringeth a snare: But whoso putteth his trust in the \sc Lord\sc* shall be safe.
Many seek the ruler’s favour; But \add every\add* man’s judgment \add cometh\add* from the \sc Lord\sc*.
An unjust man is an abomination to the just: And \add he that is\add* upright in the way \add is\add* abomination to the wicked.
